FC75ACEF365A4225BB66CD8C31340E5D.description: Explore post-secondary options and requirements related to careers in dance.

2D18B4804EEB41BD80E09A81A87C3695.description: Research a dancer, choreographer, or dance maker including analysis of their personal style, unique strengths, approaches and philosophies towards dance.

64C1B8F26C6B46E2BCA7AB04AC2607E7.description: Identify how personal identity and/or cultural ancestry influences one’s career in dance.

F02B46AB5061402097152668F9C6CD90.description: Create a job description for a dancer, choreographer or dance maker.

8DC94297D76641AC8C589E061B0EA9CD.description: Create a biography and a dance resume, including information about dance experience and accomplishments.

CB7E439C40654634A8A9ACB7823C6218.description: Identify current aspirations in relation to dance.

E1DC784BC7E040B68EAD29961227C3FA.description: Complete a survey to identify careers that would suit one’s strengths, beliefs and interests.

1797B364C12E40FBB4F12A24B205CE80.description: Research careers in dance (e.g., physiotherapist, adjudicator, examiner, teacher, performer, costume designer).

CE2666819AA64B64AC38AAB3B0E4D8D8.description: Investigate career paths related to various aspects of dance.

767D2F0AB2FD473084A23C475E5A2550.description: Interpret cultural and/or historical events and how they impacted dance types and styles.

0E22BD4F035C4ABD80AF941EEB870142.description: Explore cultural and historical contexts and their influence in the making of dances (e.g., depression era, women’s movement, industrial revolution).

7412EEF4CC3A480D81BDD345B7B83653.description: Investigate historical contexts in the making of dances (e.g., raked stages, technology, film).

254F28B0334A4D13B31EF42BF66A6075.description: Research interdisciplinary collaborators with prominent dance artists.

A86DEE2689C14DACB9DDEF8BCEBC31CC.description: Identify exemplary artists representing particular dance types and styles (e.g., Afro – Caribbean as a type of dance including calypso, merengue or mambo styles; ballet as a type of dance including classical or contemporary styles; powwow as a type of dance including grass or fancy styles; modern as a type of dance including Graham or contact improvisation styles; hip hop as a type of dance including B-boying, funk, or up rock styles).

D1567DC3EEBF4A7DB0B45C62A8A92AFF.description: Research the origins and development of particular dance artists.

9DA5A4726189405597005523B92F2B96.description: Identify and explore historical and/or cultural events expressed through dance types and styles.

CF161CE17B3F438F94A72F78FB51E528.description: Identify and examine a dance expression and dance artist(s) inspired by a historical and/or cultural event.

260CF4D3710A4B20867C7231B912098B.description: Create a response (e.g., written, oral, interdisciplinary creation) to a dance performance.

5229CD3963A64801912B82A589DC29ED.description: View and critique dance performances (e.g., live, video, film).

5E51E04D8B93435C98F0C9F72E6ABD1F.description: Critique a variety of dance types and styles in their given time period and describe similarities and differences among them.

4C43DEAC9DE84880823FC7F7ECA11DE0.description: Research a cultural and/or historical event represented by a dance artist.

66EEB5DDD28647279EE603C0D6B86872.description: Research and create a timeline (e.g., photograph, tableau, video, drawing) of historical milestones in dance.

CEC02019FA4F49BCB9712F2C96E7AE3C.description: Observe and explore dance and dance practices in a range of media and/or cultural contexts (e.g., movies, technologies, manias).

4C126F9C061844EFA14C83772103186B.description: Examine different types and styles of dance and identify key characteristics of each (e.g., ballroom as a type of dance including waltz, foxtrot or tango styles; ballet as a type of dance including classical or contemporary styles; modern as a type of dance including Graham or contact improvisation styles; hip hop as a type of dance including B-boying, funk, or up rock styles).

A63E1D5F1BB744D19DB7C83445E8ED96.description: Develop a personal dance expression in response to a cultural and/or historical event.

C494604F008746E1A8C09F7E3F656AA1.description: Conduct research (e.g., interview, articles) on a local First Nation or Métis dancer and report on findings such as philosophy or focus, subject or themes expressed, discipline specific or interdisciplinary work, and potential influence of traditional practices (e.g., ask questions such as, Do traditional practices and/or Elders influence the work you create? Does your culture influence the subject matter or themes of your work?).

3EDD43532971405093563603174569EF.description: Examine and describe the different roles of men and women in traditional dance, local and beyond.

AF602434244344EE929F8C25DA83477F.description: Describe various powwow protocols and their purposes.

F45721F953944ED2B96886BCE28946A2.description: Recognize different purposes for ceremonial dance versus social dance (e.g., Sun Dance versus powwow social dance).

4E2E5091C06C4B34918C6E5F341F3EFA.description: Examine the evolution of powwow dancing (e.g., prohibitive legislation, period of revival, modern powwows).

7075FA6E02BF4E88A0690F523A493019.description: Examine the role of Métis dances as a form of artistic expression and social connection in communities.

CA8C1B7C07174DB29CAC0A70027F7D77.description: Analyze connections between First Nations dances, the land and communities (treaty education outcome SI10 - analyze the spirit and intent of Treaties and investigate the extent to which they have been fulfilled).

2B11901752034A9E9AEE81CAE5596184.description: Discuss characteristics of traditional and contemporary Métis dances, drawing where possible and appropriate on the experience of students and expertise of community members, and discuss the historical and social contexts involved in Métis dance and music.

79A4DF29D8EA4EBF9B1B68559DEE6E8D.description: Examine characteristics of traditional and contemporary First Nations dances, drawing where possible and appropriate on the experience of students and expertise of community members.

EDD29BBCEB654AFD8DF98E937A3C18BE.description: Engage, digitally or in-person, with Métis Elders, community leaders and/or dancers to differentiate characteristics of traditional Métis dances (e.g., Rabbit Dance, Duck Dance, Red River Jig).

6BB9CF0E82DE4D06895F39245F844D62.description: Identify characteristics of First Nations social dances (e.g., partner dances) such as the Owl Dance and/or society dances such Buffalo and Hoop.

B5E9237D8BF64716B15E125398BE3F0E.description: Identify characteristics of round dances, and the types of round dance associated with different places (e.g., round dance as a social dance and round dance as a ceremonial dance).

F365712C12B14056BA33482B23EE90AE.description: Engage, digitally or in-person, with First Nations Elders, Knowledge Keepers, community leaders and/or dancers to identify characteristics of contemporary powwow dances (e.g., men’s and women’s Fancy Dance, men’s and women’s Traditional, women’s Jingle dress, men’s Chicken, men’s Grass).

33120977DAE742CF89E382F3B1E16BE7.description: Investigate Saskatchewan First Nations and Métis dances.

1563DB8191384918A22D734DF2635333.description: Cultural/Historical (CH) Goal: Students will investigate the content and aesthetics of the arts within cultural, historical, and contemporary contexts, and understand the connection between the arts and the human experience.

4A0BAFD8CEE74F9E998D36D8D2584A0A.description: Investigate the relationship between copyright and social media practices.

5C1ABF1E0D8647F3A963A7C62A8D67A7.description: Practise ethical use of source material in own work.

66B5BCE8E6E947469F3574365156ECA9.description: Research and discuss First Nations and Métis dance practices associated with specific cultural contexts (e.g., gifting dances to others, protocols related to powwow and regalia, Métis sash symbolism).

B5E22C9B03574B37BDD16C43DF4ECB1C.description: Research and discuss creation and production methods used in Western dance (e.g., written text, music, images, choreography) including ownership and copyright.

A06EE753D4544E5BBB501D152452D85C.description: Examine methods used for accessing and interpreting material in dance.

0E467376825A442087E7EFD6D1D44B1B.description: Take part in, reflect upon and respond to dances that draw on the social events and trends of a time and place.

E60B0C5C650B40A7AE6AD15A64AF9BAB.description: View, reflect upon and respond to dances that draw on the social events and trends of a time and place.

B3AC72E2FAD24901953E3F1B7D5CA99E.description: Transfer understanding of other choreographer’s work into own dance compositions (e.g., Linda Rainer’s use of pedestrian movement).

3EB421843D9C4CBB91543681FCC99C9D.description: Research ways that dancers and dance makers express ideas through movement and incorporate similar ideas in own dance.

19A212DE37834BB0A9A7157E50F63BD4.description: Describe how dance makers respond to social events and trends of their time and place.

ED99EA0BE7994044AB0F430BAA79F34A.description: Investigate the origins and evolution of various types of dance and examine styles within each type (e.g., jazz as a type of dance including styles such as swing or Charleston, Ukrainian traditional folk dances versus contemporary innovations).

6FAE73E79B54435EA6A5293E891F5C2A.description: Analyze how dance reflects the social events and trends of a time and place.

70900A2074004A5F9803C6827F83252B.description: Respond to dance compositions on an emotional, associative and formal intellectual level using frameworks and/or processes (see online curriculum resources).

CE402546C8984689A3C816929271E41A.description: Assess dance compositions according to established criteria including use of dance elements, choreographic form (e.g., canon, ABA, rondo) and devices (e.g., repetition, contrast, tension).

BD9EFDB70EEE41D3B6E5E39FA4601CEB.description: Examine and discuss how dance compositions convey ideas, vision and/or messages.

0B2EDA71533F4EEEA035126A417D66AB.description: Reflect on own, peers’ and others’ dance compositions, through various means (e.g., written, blog, discussion, interdisciplinary response).

06CD143AB4AA4701BF66E42BC32D95D4.description: Identify strengths and areas for improvement in own work.

3ECCCA2BB74344C4A2E33154C12D813A.description: Identify and articulate goals and intentions for dance, based on relevant criteria (e.g., time: duration, rhythm, tempo).

737E2586BA0448D885048BB5F2BA7D76.description: Discuss potential criteria and terminology used to analyze dance compositions.

499591FA25E441E4B4EBDD20B065345F.description: Respond critically and constructively to dance compositions using established criteria.

2236C49496BB4418BE9836972CF67F5C.description: Take personal risks in developing and sharing dance work.

AAD968BD01F84A91834B364D4B0B2EB0.description: Examine how own dance can address larger questions of personal worldview (e.g., identityrelated inquiry questions such as Where do I belong?).

4CDC2B45F40D4BCFBDFD55A0BB682552.description: Reflect on how dance has created a sense of community in the classroom.

7EBDFAC7B83D4224BDBFAB2491DB7B8C.description: Participate, digitally or in-person, in collaborative dance work with community.

DAAE8312F824436DA3293ECBAEE2ADA2.description: Recognize how dance promotes compassion and empathy for the human experience.

889A890245BD4A87A24D98BE24352C61.description: Demonstrate safe movement practices (e.g., anatomical alignment and joint mechanics) important for injury prevention.

3828D9B3506F471BB5A3E3BA4CE1D374.description: Identify and collaborate, where possible, with local role models, mentors, Elders, Knowledge Keepers and artists.

ECEE220DB60144939A80DCE6F8C2687D.description: Reflect on personal beliefs while addressing common misconceptions about dance.

2C2D3CA4D0884EE691AFD6C664215D86.description: Practise mindful and/or contemplative exercises (e.g., written reflection, video, blog) as a daily dance practice.

E9011940CB6E4367BB9B6374FCAF326B.description: Create a dance journal and identify areas of growth including strengths and challenges.

43933A76F9DE487EB4063F15B2DD29A5.description: Examine self (e.g., one’s mental, spiritual, physical, emotional growth) in relation to dance as a discipline.

72DA3016E76F4D939D675E589AAD6EB2.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) Goal: Students will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian, and International artists using critical thinking, research, creativity, and collaborative inquiry.

592785542E3E44B98C314B0342AA8FA2.description: Apply peer and teacher feedback during rehearsal process to improve performance.

214C9F9B239E4C0A9A1FEB5E75CFEB3A.description: Co-construct, with guidance, criteria for evaluating performance.

7218088E6D2C4D67A9F3F3A00717964B.description: Demonstrate one’s optimal level of ability when dancing.

7FD98448BC4447DAAB5B1998987C74FD.description: Rehearse and refine composition to convey the dance maker’s vision.

8A3195DBC83D4F6BA0810F403D844A39.description: Collaborate, problem solve and communicate clearly during rehearsal and dance performance (e.g., making adjustments in the moment, dealing with unforeseen technical difficulties).

F1280CA37C1049D7AFE4F2F53AEA2700.description: Perform popular dances from various eras.

93A7CA16F83B435E97BFFD8EC23973D6.description: Perform movement or dance compositions of various dance types and styles.

C632F4603A1E45FBA759DBF5C0CB7882.description: Perform movement or dance composition to convey aspects of daily life.

37FE7C77C5D84A66AEB0CAAE2361830B.description: Perform solo, duo or group dances to reflect aspects of daily life.

8549678E2F1B415180692C34A8B52E2E.description: Record (e.g., video, invented notation, journal notes) dance-making ideas for future use.

5847BB88BA6A430ABAA62300E4BB339A.description: Collaborate with peers and teacher during dance-making process.

0576D349280043248F44D819036E73D6.description: Practise collaboration, problem solving and clear communication during the dance-making process.

6E85A0FDBD674F678433C2BDFCF79368.description: Adapt choreography for a range of abilities.

BBE4BECB026341FA96E770178640ECD5.description: Use popular dance from various eras (e.g., Charleston, twist, jitterbug) as inspiration for own work

DBED10AA404D4098BCB65E466342862B.description: Incorporate movements and aspects of daily life into a dance composition.

7582F968A08A4BAEBB7DE5AA6181805C.description: Explore various dance-making methods and practices

A36E22E70BF941D3A0804C330443FB70.description: Experiment with dance elements and choreographic form in dance-making process.

478B32A08EF34152ADA997FCFDE9911F.description: Use an everyday item or daily routine as inspiration for dance making.

7962C4E69CCA44BCAED50753B8CB95DB.description: Create dance from everyday movements using the elements of dance and the principles of composition.

C29A547BAF42416B939137150E39AE23.description: Create solo, duo or group dances to reflect aspects of daily life.

53E382EEDD9E4158A6DB694BD8B2A31B.description: Recall and dance a sequence using the style, technique and protocols observed.

F948C7D2B1DD437C9FA55D8EE8CE03D9.description: Investigate and pose questions about the protocols and expectations associated with a particular dance type and style.

42B0A786176B42DB9D7DE11D0C9E32E8.description: Learn the foundational techniques associated with different dance types and styles.

FE309C1C06EA40C8AC0526A2ACF0C73E.description: Recognize and practise body alignment specific to the dance type and style (e.g., powwow as a type of dance including hoop or fancy styles; jazz as a type of dance including swing or jitterbug styles).

2151362109AB497D9F90A0087AE28040.description: Describe understanding of the elements of dance (i.e., body, action, space, time, energy).

F0A097EBA66641A6ADCB0CD4121869F2.description: Participate in warm-up and cool-down activities appropriate to the type and style of dance.

BD39675E91A446FB8AF84AB9A8068EBC.description: Practise technique and strategies for safe execution of dance movements.

F3485991C82C41D3BD175D679398E633.description: Define and use dance terminology and technique associated with selected dance types and styles.

E9285A409EFC45D4BBC7911830CFAB07.description: Experience various dance types and styles (e.g., ballroom as a type of dance including waltz, foxtrot or tango styles; ballet as a type of dance including classical or contemporary styles; modern as a type of dance including Graham or contact improvisation styles; hip hop as a type of dance including B-boying, funk, or up rock styles).

F3D75B29A80F4536918EAB47B1C5985E.description: Demonstrate dance technique and apply terminology related to a range of dance types and styles.

DA9B15C4D47B4B209FF085FF830C1D06.description: Creative/Productive (CP) Goal: Students will inquire, create, and communicate through dance, drama, music and visual art.
